definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

pinyin: san1 qian1 da4 qian1 shi4 jie4

definition: the thirty-two physical characteristics of Buddha
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
Chakravarti raja (Sanskrit: King of Kings)/emperor in Hindu mythology
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
measure of length, ten Chinese feet (3.3 m)/to measure/husband/polite appellation for an older male
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
incantation (Sanskrit: dharani)/religious chant (promoting virtue and obstructing evil)
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
